Definition: a primitive root; properly, to strip; but used as denominative from {{h6189}}; to expose or remove the prepuce, whether literal (to go naked) or figurative (to refrain from using); count uncircumcised, foreskin to be uncovered.
from {{h6188}}; properly, exposed, i.e. projecting loose (as to the prepuce); used only technically, uncircumcised (i.e. still having the prepuce uncurtailed); uncircumcised (person).

a primitive root; to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications); put (set) (the battle, self) in array, compare, direct, equal, esteem, estimate, expert (in war), furnish, handle, join (battle), ordain, (lay, put, reckon up, set) (in) order, prepare, tax, value.
from {{h6186}}; a pile, equipment, estimate; equal, estimation, (things that are set in) order, price, proportion, × set at, suit, taxation, × valuest.
from {{h6206}}; fearful, i.e. powerful or tyrannical; mighty, oppressor, in great power, strong, terrible, violent.
from {{h6209}}; bare, i.e. destitute (of children); childless.
from an unused root meaning to comminute; meal; dough.
from {{h6201}}; the sky (as drooping at the horizon); heaven.
patronymically of {{h6179}}; an Erite (collectively) or descendants of Eri; Erites.
for {{h6172}}; nudity; bare, naked, × quite.
from {{h6105}}; a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame; body, bone, × life, (self-) same, strength, × very.
the same as {{h6106}}; bone; Etsem, a place in Palestine; Azem, Ezem.
from {{h6101}}; indolence; idleness.

a primitive root; also denominatively (from {{h6106}}); to bind fast, i.e. close (the eyes); intransitively, to be (causatively, make) powerful or numerous; to crunch the bones; break the bones, close, be great, be increased, be (wax) mighty(-ier), be more, shut, be(-come, make) strong(-er).
from {{h6101}}; indolent; slothful, sluggard.
feminine of {{h6102}}; (as abstractly) indolence; slothfulness.
a primitive root; to lean idly, i.e. to be indolent or slack; be slothful.
from {{h6105}}; power; hence, body; might, strong, substance.
feminine of {{h6108}}; powerfulness; by extension, numerousness; abundance, strength.
from {{h6131}}; figuratively, a transplanted person, i.e. naturalized citizen; stock.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6131}}; pluck up by the roots.
a primitive root; to pluck up (especially by the roots); specifically, to hamstring; figuratively, to exterminate; dig down, hough, pluck up, root up.
from an unused root meaning to twist; tortuous; Akan, an Idummaean; Akan. Compare {{h3292}}.
of uncertain derivation; a scorpion; figuratively, a scourge or knotted whip; scorpion.
(Aramaic) from {{h6132}}; a stock; stump.
from {{h6131}}; sterile (as if extirpated in the generative organs); (× male or female) barren (woman).
the same as {{h6133}}; Eker, an Israelite; Eker.
or עֶקְרֹנִי; patrial from {{h6138}}; an Ekronite or inhabitant of Ekron; Ekronite.
from {{h6131}}; eradication; Ekron, a place in Palestine; Ekron.
from {{h6127}}; winding; by(-way), crooked way.
from {{h6127}}; tortuous; crooked.
from {{h6123}}; striped (with bands); ring straked.
from {{h5781}}; constraint; oppression.
from {{h6117}}; insidious; Akkub, the name of five Israelites; Akkub.
a primitive root; to wrest; wrong.
from {{h6117}} in its denominative sense; a lier in wait; heel (by mistake for {{h6119}}).
from {{h6117}}; in the original sense, a knoll (as swelling up); in the denominative sense; (transitive) fraudulent or (intransitive) tracked; crooked, deceitful, polluted.
feminine of an unused form from {{h6117}} meaning a trick; trickery; subtilty.
a primitive root; to tie with thongs; bind.
or עוֹרֵב; the same as {{h6158}}; Oreb, the name of a Midianite and of the cliff near the Jordan; Oreb.
or עוֹרֵב; from {{h6150}}; a raven (from its dusky hue); raven.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6148}}; to commingle; mingle (self), mix.
a primitive root (rather identical with {{h6148}} through the idea of covering with a texture); to grow dusky at sundown; be darkened, (toward) evening.
from {{h6150}}; dusk; day, even(-ing, tide), night.
or עֲרַב; from {{h6150}} in the figurative sense of sterility; Arab (i.e. Arabia), a country East of Palestine; Arabia.
from {{h6148}}; a willow (from the use of osiers as wattles); willow.
or עֶרֶב; (1 Kings 10:15), (with the article prefix), from {{h6148}}; the web (or transverse threads of cloth); also a mixture, (or mongrel race); Arabia, mingled people, mixed (multitude), woof.
from {{h6148}}; a mosquito (from its swarming); divers sorts of flies, swarm.
from {{h6149}}; pleasant; sweet.

a primitive root; to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange); engage, (inter-) meddle (with), mingle (self), mortgage, occupy, give pledges, be(-come, put in) surety, undertake.
a primitive root (rather identical with {{h6148}} through the idea of close association); to be agreeable; be pleasant(-ing), take pleasure in, be sweet.
the same as {{h6141}}; perverse; Ikkesh, an Israelite; Ikkesh.
from {{h6141}}; perversity; × froward.
a primitive root; to knot or distort; figuratively, to pervert (act or declare perverse); make crooked, (prove, that is) perverse(-rt).
from {{h6140}}; distorted; hence, false; crooked, froward, perverse.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6145}}; enemy.
from {{h5782}}; watchful; Er, the name of two Israelites; Er.
the same as {{h5892}}; a city; Ar, a place in Moab; Ar.
from {{h5782}}; a foe (as watchful for mischief); enemy.
patronymically from {{h6177}}; an Aroerite or inhabitant of Aroer; Aroerite.
or עֲרֹעֵר; or עַרְעוֹר; the same as {{h6176}}; nudity of situation; Aroër, the name of three places in or near Palestine; Aroer.
or עַרְעָר; from {{h6209}} reduplicated; a juniper (from its nudity of situation); health.
passive participle of {{h6191}}; cunning (usually in a bad sense); crafty, prudent, subtil.
or עָרֹם; from {{h6191}} (in its original sense); nude, either partially or totally; naked.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6172}}; nakedness, i.e. (figuratively) impoverishment; dishonor.
from {{h6168}}; nudity, literally (especially the pudenda) or figuratively (disgrace, blemish); nakedness, shame, unclean(-ness).
from the same as {{h6166}}; an onager (from his lonesome habits); wild ass.
or עֲרֻגָה; feminine passive participle of {{h6165}}; something piled up (as if (figuratively) raised by mental aspiration), i.e. a paterre; bed, furrow.
from {{h5782}}; watchful; Eri, an Israelite; Eri.
passive participle of {{h6206}}; feared, i.e. (concretely) a horrible place or chasm; cliffs.

from {{h6150}} (in the sense of sterility); a desert; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea; Arabah, champaign, desert, evening, heaven, plain, wilderness. See also {{h1026}}.
feminine passive participle of {{h6048}} in the sense of a bargain or exchange; something given as security, i.e. (literally) a token (of safety) or (metaphorically) a bondsman; pledge, surety.
from {{h6148}} (in the sense of exchange); a pawn (given as security); pledge.
or עַרְבִי; patrial from {{h6152}}; an Arabian or inhabitant of Arab (i.e. Arabia); Arabian.
patrial from {{h1026}}; an Arbathite or inhabitant of (Beth-) Arabah; Arbahite.
a primitive root; to long for; cry, pant.
from an unused root meaning to sequester itself; fugitive; Arad, the name of a place near Palestine, also of a Canaanite and an Israelite; Arad.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6171}}; an onager; wild ass.
a primitive root; to be (causatively, make) bare; hence, to empty, pour out, demolish; leave destitute, discover, empty, make naked, pour (out), rase, spread self, uncover.
feminine from {{h6168}}; a naked (i.e. level) plot; paper reed.
from {{h6209}}; naked, i.e. (figuratively) poor; destitute. See also {{h6176}}.
patronymically from {{h6197}}; an Eranite or descendant (collectively) of Eran; Eranites.
feminine of {{h6193}}; trickery; or (in a good sense) discretion; guile, prudence, subtilty, wilily, wisdom.
(Jeremiah 50:26) or (feminine) עֲרֵמָה; from {{h6192}}; a heap; specifically, a sheaf; heap (of corn), sheaf.
probably from {{h5782}}; watchful; Eran, an Israelite; Eran.
probably from {{h6191}}; the plane tree (from its smooth and shed bark); chestnut tree.

a primitive root; properly, to be (or make) bare; but used only in the derivative sense (through the idea perhaps of smoothness) to be cunning (usually in a bad sense); × very, beware, take crafty (counsel), be prudent, deal subtilly.
feminine of {{h6189}}; the prepuce; foreskin,   uncircumcised.
from {{h6191}}; a stratagem; craftiness.
a primitive root; to pile up; gather together.
from {{h6113}}; closure; also constraint; × barren, oppression, × prison.
from {{h6113}}; restraint; magistrate.

a primitive root; properly, to swell out or up; used only as denominative from {{h6119}},; to seize by the heel; figuratively, to circumvent (as if tripping up the heels); also to restrain (as if holding by the heel); take by the heel, stay, supplant, × utterly.
or עֲצֶרֶת; from {{h6113}}; an assembly, especially on a festival or holiday; (solemn) assembly (meeting).
or עַצְמֹן; from {{h6107}}; bone-like; Atsmon, a place near Palestine; Azmon.
feminine of {{h6099}}; a bulwark, i.e. (figuratively) argument; strong.

a primitive root; to inclose; by analogy, to hold back; also to maintain, rule, assemble; × be able, close up, detain, fast, keep (self close, still), prevail, recover, refrain, × reign, restrain, retain, shut (up), slack, stay, stop, withhold (self).
from an unused root meaning to be sharp or strong; a spear; Eznite (from the margin).
or (feminine) עִקְּבָה; from {{h6117}}; a heel (as protuberant); hence, a track; figuratively, the rear (of an army); heel, (horse-) hoof, last, lier in wait (by mistake for {{h6120}}), (foot-) step.

from {{h6117}} in the sense of {{h6119}}; a heel, i.e. (figuratively) the last of anything (used adverbially, for ever); also result, i.e. compensation; and so (adverb with preposition or relatively) on account of; × because, by, end, for, if, reward.
